subject: Real Estate
title: Japan's Lost Decade of Real Estate
description: A short lesson to help you apply Japan's Lost Decade of Real Estate.

hook.text: In 1991, Japan's property bubble burst. Tokyo land prices fell for 15 consecutive years.

buildup.text: At the peak, the Imperial Palace grounds were famously valued higher than all the real estate in California.

discovery.text: Banks had lent aggressively against inflated land values. When prices fell, loans turned toxic.

twist.text: The government propped up failing banks instead of letting them collapse, prolonging the agony.

climax.text: Japan's experience proved that a property crash can suppress an entire economy for a generation.

punchline.text: Japan's one lost decade became three.

quiz.question: How long did Tokyo land prices fall after the 1991 bubble burst?
